title: ParaBoi
author: ParaBoi
content: Being a new member of this forum, I will like to have more clarification and advice, and I will also like to know if there are any PDFs or any sources that I can be directed to study more in order to not offend the law of the forum and avoid any penalties or having my account banned. I will be glad to have many pieces of advice for other members of the forum.

comments.author: Egii Nna
comments.body: You are welcome to this forum and who ever directed you or introduce you to this forum really help you a lot because this forum is where you will have adequate knowledge about bitcoin and other crypto currency’s so I will share some of the links I used to have my own experience so that you can also achieve what I have achieved so farYou can click Newbies read before posting it will guide on how to operate on the forum. Also you can click Everything you need to know about forum activities,account ranks,merit system  You can use this Beginners encyclopedia

comments.author: pakhitheboss
comments.body: Hey! Welcome to the forum. Everything about rules can be found in this thread, Unofficial list of (official) Bitcointalk.org rules, guidelines, FAQ. No, there isn't a PDF for you to read. The thread does gives you an idea as to how to proceed..

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: The rules have been linked above.But to summarize: don't spam, don't plagiarize, and don't do dumb stuff in general. Done. Bitcointalk isn't some extremely-formal organization/company whereas you have to follow very strict and ludicrous rules. It's just a typical online forum — just with people that likes to talk about Bitcoin/crypto.

I will be glad to have many pieces of advice for other members of the forum.Good thing you want to know more about the forum first before any other thing because the mistake most newbies make when they join the forum is not get familiar with the forum, they just feel once you are a member you can do whatever you wish and they assume there are no rules guiding the forum. There are rules here and there are some things we all avoid here that are not tolerated and once you break those rules things will not be taken lightly with you so try to follow the rules of the forum.Just as mk4 mentioned, avoid spamming, avoid plagiarism (copying and pasting of other people's work) from within or outside the forum and don’t try to scam other users. there are several rules so you just have to abide by them. I can see other users have shared you some links already that contains rules and some and other information about the forum so make sure you read them carefully.

But you could download the bitcoin whitepaper and read it. It can help to add knowledge on bitcoin aside from the idea here on forum.

comments.author: Finestream
comments.body: Quote from: ParaBoi on August 30, 2023, 03:20:27 AMBeing a new member of this forum, I will like to have more clarification and advice, and I will also like to know if there are any PDFs or any sources that I can be directed to study more in order to not offend the law of the forum and avoid any penalties or having my account banned. I will be glad to have many pieces of advice for other members of the forum. If you want to be aware about the rules, then everything is laid dow in the forum, just read and understand every details listed in the forum. As long as you follow them, you’re safe and free from any forms of ban. And to tell you frankly, you don’t have to be instantly good at posting. Everything has its own process and by doing all your due diligence to learn about the insights in the forum, rest assured that you’ll be a great poster in the making. Be patient and never rush in profits. You’ll end up earning a good compensation when you are well equipped with knowledge and skills later on.

comments.author: Free Market Capitalist
comments.body: If I were a stats freak I would investigate how many of these accounts that want everything handed to them on a platter instead of investigating themselves make it far in this forum. I would bet that the percentage is very low. How often do we get questions like this? Weekly at least. I have been and still am a member of other forums and I never see this question asked on them. I imagine the economic component in this one is what accounts for it. OP, I too welcome you to the forum but my advice is to search for yourself, be self-reliant, and if you have to ask specific questions ask them after you have done some research.

comments.author: Cantsay
comments.body: Quote from: ParaBoi on August 30, 2023, 03:20:27 AMBeing a new member of this forum, I will like to have more clarification and advice, and I will also like to know if there are any PDFs or any sources that I can be directed to study more in order to not offend the law of the forum and avoid any penalties or having my account banned. I will be glad to have many pieces of advice for other members of the forum.The issue is not about receiving advice the main issue here is; will you read and put them into action? I have seen so many users come to the forum and ask the same questions and got good responses like, don’t spam, don’t plagiarise read the forum rules etc and before they spent a month in the forum their account got ban from plagiarism. If you can take your time to follow the advice that has been provided here you’ll be able to get the best from the forum but if you pay a fldeaf ear to the rules and think you can get away from breaking the rules you’ll only end up regretting it. So just keep it at the back of your mind that if you ever go against the rules of the forum you’ll surely get the punishment no matter how long it takes it will surely come out.

comments.body: Quote from: ParaBoi on August 30, 2023, 03:20:27 AMBeing a new member of this forum, I will like to have more clarification and advice, and I will also like to know if there are any PDFs or any sources that I can be directed to study more in order to not offend the law of the forum and avoid any penalties or having my account banned. comments.author: Majestic-milf
comments.body: You need advice on how to behave on the forum? Be yourself. Well, others have provided links to help you further understand how we work here but personal advice? Read more than you make posts because that way you can be able to contribute intelligently other than spamming and missing the point of conversation.When you make your posts, if the ideas are not yours try to provide a link so you won't be banned for plagiarism and also, others can be able to read more and get info about what you are talking about. Another thing that can guarantee your growth is your consistency; try not to be a one off person or disappear at the first sight if criticism because that way you not just learn newer things, but also your reputation grows.
